definition: affair/business/matter/to be engaged in/to attend to/by all means

sentences.english: Does your spouse have a chore they despise?
sentences.chinese: 你的伴侶有什麼不喜歡做的雜務嗎？

sentences.english: Ensure house is tidy and scheduled chores/jobs are completed.
sentences.chinese: 將屋子打掃乾淨，並確保日常雜務都已按期完成。

sentences.english: You can make money if you concentrate on producing services that will make domestic chores easier.
sentences.chinese: 如果你能專注於爲家庭雜務提供便利，你能賺錢的。

sentences.english: Do these chores take up a large part of your day?
sentences.chinese: 做這些家庭雜務佔據了你每天很大部分的時間？

sentences.english: But there are dozens, hundreds, of little chores to be done.
sentences.chinese: 但是有幾十件，幾百件小雜務要幹。

sentences.english: Work slowly when doing outside chores.

definition: to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
to take care of/to raise money/to attend to (guests, customers etc)
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
to angle for fame (idiom)/to fish for compliments
drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
to make trouble out of nothing
